id: A look at Floyd Mayweather's newly built $10 million Las Vegas mansionA look at Floyd Mayweather's newly built $10 million Las Vegas mansionA look at Floyd Mayweather's newly built $10 million Las Vegas mansion

Boxing legend Floyd Mayweather Jr. has long been active in the real-estate game, and he recently added to his impressive collection of homes.One year after dropping $25.5 million on a stunning Beverly Hills mansion to celebrate his win over Conor McGregor, Mayweather purchased a $10 million home in Las Vegas — according to the Los Angeles Times.The 11-bed, 14-bath home is 21,861 square feet with multiple guest houses, indoor and outdoor pools, massive courtyard and a 20-car underground garage.The purchase of the newly built home was done in an off-market sale. Though there aren’t interior photos of the house, Luxury Estates broker and founder Kamran Zand has provided an exterior look at the home.Credit: Kamran Zand/Luxury Estates InternationalCredit: Kamran Zand/Luxury Estates InternationalCredit: Kamran Zand/Luxury Estates InternationalCredit: Kamran Zand/Luxury Estates InternationalCredit: Kamran Zand/Luxury Estates InternationalCredit: Kamran Zand/Luxury Estates InternationalCredit: Kamran Zand/Luxury Estates InternationalCredit: Kamran Zand/Luxury Estates InternationalCredit: Kamran Zand/Luxury Estates InternationalCredit: Kamran Zand/Luxury Estates InternationalCool houses, Floyd Mayweather Jr., Boxing
		Andrew Joseph is a writer at For The Win. He can tell the Morris twins apart, and he once shared an elevator with Matthew McConaughey.
